lines.gurmukhi: aulit pvn mn mIn kI cpl giq dsm duAwr pwr Agm invws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ulati Pavan Man Meen Kee Chapal Gati , Dasam Duaar Paar Agam Nivaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Kabit  - By practicing Naam Simran and breathing exercises, the fish-like sharp and wind-like fast blowing mind acquires a stable place beyond the tenth door which is inaccessible.

lines.gurmukhi: qh n pwvk pvn jl piRQmI Akws nwih sis sUr auqpiq n ibnws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Tah N Paavak Pavan Jal Pridamee Akaasa , Naahi Sasi Soor Outapati N Binaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: At that place neither the effect of five elements like air, fire etc., nor of Sun or Moon or even of creation is experienced.

lines.gurmukhi: nwih prikriq ibriq ipMf pRwn igAwn sbd suriq nih diRsit n pRgws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Naahi Parakirati Birati Pind Praan Giaana , Sabad Surati Nahi Drisati N Pragaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: It experiences no effect of any material desires nor of body or life sustaining elements. It is unaware of words and sounds. No effect of any light or vision exists there.

lines.gurmukhi: sÍwmI nw syvk aunmwn Anhd prY inrwlMb suMn mY n ibsm ibsÍws hY ]529]
lines.transliteration_english: Svaamee Naa Sayvak Ounamaan Anahad Parai , Niraalanb Sounn Mai N Bisam Bisvaas Hai ?529?

Shabad OS B.translation: Beyond that divine state and in the inaccessible region, there is no master and no follower. In that non-existent realm of inactivity and hibernation, one is never in any form of wondrous state (wondrous or unusual events do not take place any more).
